channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Maryland Football Yards per Play
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggrepel) Got data pxp_2011_2022 <- read.csv("https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/footballlogs1122.csv") pxp_2011_2022 <- pxp_2011_2022 %>% mutate( wins = case_when( grepl("W", Outcome) ~ 1, grepl("L", Outcome) ~ 0) ) ypp <- pxp_2011_2022 %>% group_by(Team, Season) %>% summarise( TotalPlays = sum(OffensivePlays), TotalYards = sum(OffensiveYards), DefensivePlays = sum(DefPlays), DefensiveYards = sum(DefYards), TotalWins = sum(wins)) %>% mutate( OffensiveYPP = TotalYards/TotalPlays, DefensiveYPP = DefensiveYards/DefensivePlays) ## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'Team'.

item.title: Do high recruits lead to wins in college football?
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() team_records <- read.csv("https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/all_teams.csv") team_recruiting <- read.csv("https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/all_rankings.csv") records_and_recruiting = team_recruiting %>% inner_join(team_records,by=c("team", "year")) umd <- records_and_recruiting %>% filter(team == "Maryland") Now we have a dataframe with the records and recruiting.

item.title: First Pass Interceptions
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(cfbfastR) ## install.packages("tictoc") library(tictoc) tictoc::tic() pbp <- data.frame() seasons <- 2014:cfbfastR:::most_recent_cfb_season() progressr::with_progress({ pbp <- cfbfastR::load_cfb_pbp(seasons) }) tictoc::toc() ## 72.

item.title: Examining how Big Ten Volleyball teams score with Waffle Charts
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(waffle) vbdata <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dwillis/NCAAWomensVolleyballData/main/data/ncaa_womens_volleyball_matchstats_2022.csv") md_vb_data <- vbdata %>% filter(team == "Maryland Terrapins, Terps") %>% group_by(team) %>% summarize(totalkills = sum(kills), totalblocks = sum(block_solos + round(block_assists/2)), totalaces = sum(aces)) %>% mutate(totalsum = totalkills+totalblocks+totalaces) msu_vb_data <- vbdata %>% filter(team == "Michigan St.

item.title: College Football Average Plays
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(scales) ## ## Attaching package: 'scales' ## ## The following object is masked from 'package:purrr': ## ## discard ## ## The following object is masked from 'package:readr': ## ## col_factor cfb21 <- read.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
